column2: Winry Rockbell and the Wizard Rebels
column4:
Ed has gone missing while on a research trip. Lucky for him, Winry installed a tracking device in his leg automail after Promised Day and decides to go looking for him. On her quest, she stumbles upon Wizard London.

Set during the summer before Harry’s fifth year (a few weeks before the dementor attack), and after FMAB.
column6: Ed has alchemy and one automail limb (his leg). Ed stayed a State Alchemist, but still went West while Al went East like at the end of Brotherhood. He and Winry are engaged and haven’t seen each other since the proposal but they send letters back and forth and call each other all the time.

column2: when we have shuffled off this mortal coil
column4: It was written in their souls aeons ago. They would be together, and nothing would ever change that. Not even death itself.
column6:
You know that serious version of 'A Long Way From Home' and 'Finding Family' that I promised - because those two were basically just a mix of fluff, crack, and angst... Yeah?

Well, this is it.

I make no promises on keeping everything canon, because there will be some alterations - because you know that still lake called canon? Imma drop some rocks in. Four of them to be precise. I love Tolkien's lore, but this is a crossover, ergo I don't feel absolutely terrible for playing fast and loose with canon (which is really hard to do when it comes to the world of Tolkien's creation). Anyway, you asked for a serious version of bby!elf Team Seven, so I'm gonna give you some feral bby!elf Team Seven... with actual plot this time.

column4:
After being humiliated during a sparring match, Sakura realizes that she no longer wants to chase after a boy. With a newfound sense of determination, she sets off to become a truly terrifying kunoichi, making her fair share of friends and enemies along the way.

In other words, Sakura discovers who she really wants to be and fucks shit up along the way. And if she poisons a few important people? Well, that's just collateral damage.

Begins during Sakura's final year at the academy and then onward.
column7:
Hey y'all, hope you're having a good day

I don't think its possible to explain how painful it was to write Sakura in her fangirling form when she was thinking about Sasuke. I'm pretty sure it took years off my life.

Anyway, that's all for now

Constructive criticism is welcome, hate will be laughed at and the gay will be strong

byyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyye

column7: LQR will eventually figure out the truth, but by then, he will be so thoroughly besotted with his new grand-nieces and nephews that he will decide he doesn't care as long as the elders never find out. LWJ is probably going to invent parthenogenesis via cultivation just so she never has to explain what actually happened to the elders/anyone, even if by then, they won't need it themselves and in fact are happier with LXC as the father of their children. Gusu Lan Sect becomes famous for new reproductive cultivation practices and teaches a clinic each year that revolutionizes the entire next generation, which becomes incredibly queer and feminist, and the Lan elders die mad about it.

column4:
Soul bonds allow a person to feel the emotions (or even the pain, in extreme circumstances) of another person. Whether it be platonic or romantic, there seems to be no limit to the amount of people whose fates can be intertwined with one another.

Aizawa never expected this class to be anything special, he just expected a normal damn year, so imagine his surprise when over the course of a few months, he formed bonds with a whole host of problem children, whom he started to consider his own. Some of the kids didn't even notice the bond and Aizawa plans to keep it that way.

Or

Aizawa finds out that Shirakumo is Kurogiri, and all of Class 1-A feel it happen. (It's literally just Dadzawa angst)

column4:
"It’s not that his peers are inherently cruel to the Quirkless. Izuku firmly believes that, if the truth ever got out to his classmates, they would still welcome him with open arms. At the same time though, acceptance does not necessarily mean they are well-informed on the subject. His classmates might be well-intentioned, but sometimes the words that come out of their mouths cut deeper than even he could have ever expected."

OR

In which Izuku possesses the words and knowledge to try and correct his classmate's misguided beliefs concerning Quirkless people, but actually communicating them is another challenge altogether.
column5: [['Translation into Русский available: О предвзятости и храбрости by LinAndSin', ['О предвзятости и храбрости', '/works/32287033'], ['LinAndSin', '/users/LinAndSin/pseuds/LinAndSin']]]
column6:
Hi everyone, this is my first fic in the bnha fandom and I'm actually super excited about it. It's been a long time since I've watched the show, but recently I've been reading a lot of fics for it and it's reignited a lot of the love I have for it. Something that's always bothered me though (and some other fans apparently) is how Quirklessness/Quirkless discrimination is not something that's really addressed past the introductory episodes. With Izuku especially, I think there's an interesting struggle there as someone who was born Quirkless and only now has a Quirk. As such, I've decided to explore it here.

Content warnings for this fic include: References to bullying, suicide of an OC off screen, past suicidal ideation of a major character, and overall just ignorant/unintentionally hurtful comments made against a marginalized group. If you feel like I missed something, please let me know and I'll be sure to update this list!

I hope you enjoy the fic and please let me know what you think in the comments. I'd especially love to hear how you think I did with characterization since I'm still pretty new to working with these characters. Hopefully I do them justice!
column7:
Thank you all for reading! You can find my on tumblr under the username white-weasel. I don't post a lot of bnha but I figured I'd put it out there.

One other note, the idea of special shoes exclusively for Quirkless people isn't completely mine. Rather, I just expanded on it a bit as my mind saw fit. As such, I want to credit the author of this tumblr post for it:
https://the-final-sif.tumblr.com/post/190832718694/i-recently-had-a-life-changing-revelation-and

Once again thanks for reading! I hope you enjoyed this fic because I definitely had a lot of fun writing it :)

column2: pride is not the word I'm looking for
column4:
Shang Qinghua goes to take a self-indulgent peek at his baby protagonist son and gets a kick to the shrivelled heart for his troubles. He gave up on changing the story years ago! Yet he finds himself helping his protagonist son's adoptive mother anyway. Just this one change won't matter too much, right?

One little change leads to more. Shang Qinghua never meant to care, but he becomes invested in making sure that his new family survives the looming plot. With the changes to the world cascading around him, with his position as a traitor pulling him between his sect and a certain ice demon, and with the protagonist growing up so quickly, how is one displaced author meant to ensure that everything turns out all right?

A Pre-Canon to Canon Divergence story.
column6:
Hi! This is really just self-indulgent fun, inspired by my membership in various "Unfridge the Mom" fanfiction clubs. I don't always go back to reference canon's itty bitty details, so please take all plot holes and continuity errors as a Crack Treated Seriously AU or humorous universe alterations, please! There are many different ways to interpret this world and these characters; I had a self-indulgent blast with the worldbuilding and some alternate character interpretations just to tell this one story.

I'm not looking for concrit, if you please; just looking to share my fun.

This fic is divided into different parts and I've marked a few break points along the way. Part 1 goes from chapters 1-8 (roughly 60,000 words). Part 2 goes from chapters 9-17 (roughly 74,000 words). Part 3 is from chapters 18-31 (18-22 is roughly 34,000 words, 23-31 is roughly 85,000 words). Part 4 is from 32 onwards. Part 4 is the longest part of the fic, but it too has parts and some break points (32-38 is roughly 46,000 words, 39-50 is roughly 111,000 words).

EDIT: The "Original Shen Qingqiu Sympathetic" tag is there because there's a storyline later on with him. He's still asshole-ish, but Shang Qinghua is also an asshole, so there's empathy there between them. (SQH likes Mobei-Jun, after all.) I'm not into character bashing and I generally prefer leaning towards kinder interpretations of all characters, so I'm trying to weigh the extremely different perceptions and interpretations of various characters (especially the ever-divisive Shen Jiu) and treat them all carefully.

2nd EDIT: Moshang is a big part of this fic, but this fic is... I'm not sure how to put this... Families of Choice is the most important relationship in this fic. This fic is not so much a Moshang fic, in my opinion, as it is a fic that has Moshang in it. So, if you're not here for platonic relationships and just want to focus solely on Moshang romance, this fic may not be for you. Though, again, Moshang is a big part of this fic!

3rd EDIT: A cheat sheet for the order of peaks & peak lords and non-canon peaks & peak lords I'm using.

4th EDIT: We're finally all done! To everyone only recently picking up PINTWILF, then I hope you have fun! I enjoy it when people visit or revisit my "old" stories (after all, I reread and re-reread my own writing every now and again, since, hey, I like what I wrote), so feel free to say hello anytime. Several times, even! On every chapter if you like! It never gets old.

Please note that this story was finished several months before the official translation came out, so some terminology and other details will not match until I get around to performing another edit.

This story was originally written as weekly installments, so remember to take those breaks if you need them.

There is a podfic of PINTWILF by Opalsong! With great voices and fun sound effects!

Enjoy! 😘💕❤️
column7:
- I kind of wanted to explore the fact that Airplane Bro (if you're counting both lives) has to be at least 50 or 60 years old by the time that Shen Yuan comes into the picture. He's been here for decades! Shen Yuan is twenty-something, maybe? Airplane Bro is almost definitely twice Cucumber Bro's age! He's surrounded by babies!

- I also wanted to write something in which Shang Qinghua psyches himself into having something resembling morals and actually manages to significantly shift canon all by himself, through the domino effect of saving just one person.

- I know that Luo Binghe's adoptive mother was not a young woman in canon! (And I don't think that she was coerced into sex work out of desperation. The dream world being built on unreliable memories gives SOME leeway, but not really THAT much. Still!) It's an alternate character interpretation! I'm just trying to make Shang Qinghua feel as terrible about this situation as possible. I'm also playing on his apparent hack-author habit of making things as ridiculously maudlin as possible, especially in regards to Luo Binghe's tragic childhood. Whatever made PIDW real took your trope-abusing implications and ran with them, Airplane Bro!

- No Shang Qinghua/Luo Jiahui here! Totally platonic. Minor Moshang later maybe.

- EDIT: Okay, yeah, no, there's definitely Moshang later.

- Updating again next Wednesday! Bye! 😘💕❤️

column4:
George and Dream don't let their second genders get in the way of their friendship, even when most people balk at the idea of letting soft-looking Omega George live with boisterous Alpha Dream. So what if George likes Dream's scent and Dream likes to take care of George? They're just two best friends trying to get through life while Sapnap laughs at them being idiots.

Until everything goes horribly wrong in one day.

(After a slight misunderstanding, Omega George goes into a particularly awful heat and Alpha Dream must decide what his dear friend really means to him.)
column6:
This was written over one week and was meant to be an oneshot. After realizing that the word count totals over 20,000 words, I realized that maybe I should break it up. So if you notice that the chapter beginnings and ends are a bit clunky, my deepest apologies. I have been writing in a feverish haze without editing or a Beta reader in order to indulge myself and so this isn't really the best work.

It is also my first attempt at writing smut, so apologies if it seems strange.

First chapter is all fluff and a bit of angst from our dear, oblivious Dream. With a very confused George and an unlucky Techno added in for flavor. Enjoy!

Obligatory disclaimer: I highly respect the content creators in this piece and would never dream of forcing characteristics, sexual orientations, relationships, or any other particular labels onto them. If they ever request that this kind of content be taken down, I will immediately do so. Again, to reiterate, I understand that their real selves and the characters or personas I portray in my writing are in no way the same and I respect them and thank them for their willingness for letting me as a content consumer to express and interpret myself through their work.
column7:
Dream: *is super attuned to George's scent and emotions, brings George coffee even if it makes him late, likes seeing him wearing his hoodie, packs him lunch, basically takes care of him like an Alpha taking care of his mated Omega*

Dream: haha, we're best friends!

Dream: Wait.

Dream:

Dream: Oh, fuck.

column4:
Meng Yao arrives at the Cloud Recesses as Nie-gongzi's attendant. Zewu-Jun allows him to stay for the lectures. There's something about this place, and the man who rules it, that triggers an irrevocable change in him.

And so, Meng Yao sees two paths unfold before him: one that leads him towards power, and one that leads him somewhere completely different.

column4:
“Wei Ying,” Meng Yao says, “do you know what a pet is for?”

Wei Ying watches a blush creep into his own cheeks in the mirror. “Um… companionship?”

Meng Yao reemerges with a long needle. “Yes,” he says patiently, holding the needle over a candle flame, “that’s true. But there’s more to it than that. A pet makes their master look good. As a noble Lan Wangji has to follow certain rules. He can’t dress too extravagantly. But he can dress his pet however he wants. The more expensive you look, the more desirable you are, the more powerful Lan Wangji is. Do you understand?”

/

In which Wei Ying is the new pet in town, Meng Yao lends a hand, and Xue Yang is just here for a good time.

column6:
Third cake for this prompt! I stuck a little closer to canon setting and made Jin Zixuan the emperor, mostly for the aesthetic. Tags will be updated as the story goes on.

Fair warning: i am not the quickest writer so I make no promises on updates BUT I am excited about this fic and it's a lot of fun to write.

De anon please!

Prompt:
Worldbuilding/Backstory
This draws inspiration from some of the worldbuilding from the Veretian court in Captive Prince, but requires no real knowledge of the series. Basically, the gentry hate bastardry so much that all pre-marital and extra-marital sex is expected to be non-procreative, i.e. cisnormatively gay. It is normal and even encouraged for members of the gentry to employ a "pet," an attendant of the same assigned sex who sees to their sexual needs. Pets are brought along to court events and shown off; exhibitionism with pets is normal, and people may direct their pets to play with each other or to service onlookers.

My prompt takes that slightly further and says that bastards themselves are so looked down on that often the highest they can hope to rise in society is as a particularly pampered pet, since they are turned down for many respectable jobs and are somewhat expected to take pet work because it's seen as atoning for their shameful existence by preventing more bastards.

It has just been discovered that Wei Wuxian's parents never officially got married before they died, making him a bastard and thus ineligible for the bright future he once had. Wei Wuxiann gets rather abruptly recruited to be the first pet of Lan Wangji.

He has no "pet" training and has no idea what he's meant to be doing. Lan Wangji has no idea what to do with him either. They know each other from those 3 months they attended the Imperial Academy together, before Wei Wuxian got expelled; as in canon, Lan Wangji fell hard, then didn't say anything about it to Wei Wuxian, who is somewhat under the impression Lan Wangji dislikes him immensely. When he heard Wei Wuxian was about to be kicked out of the Jiang Sect, a lovesick and protective Lan Wangji jumped in and asked to buy a pet contract from him, intending to simply never ask Wei Wuxian for any normal pet duties and let him go on studying cultivation like before.

The trick is going to be Wei Wuxian realizing he WANTS to be doing normal pet duties (e.g. getting fed lotus seeds on Lan Wangji's lap, sucking LWJ's dick during boring court events, wearing impossibly slutty outfits and ropes of pearls while flirting shamelessly with LWJ in front of their old school friends, getting held down and railed till he cries, etc...) And then he has to get Lan Wangji to believe his wants are genuine.

Lan Xichen in the background has Meng Yao for his pet, gifted to him - secondhand, as it were - by Nie Mingjue. This is practically a whole secondary prompt, and feel free to focus only on this bit, but I imagine power bottom!Meng Yao trying to figure out how to get LXC to admit to himself that he, LXC, actually wants to be on the other side of the master/pet dynamic, and that furthermore, he wants NMJ and MY domming him from above and below (or behind and in front) simultaneously.

column4:
Things are looking up for Cadet Cloud Strife. He actually has friends, unlike in Nibelheim, and now General Sephiroth of all people wants to train him personally. If only he could figure out why everybody keeps asking him if he remembers.

Or: A Time Travel Fix-it where everybody but Cloud remembers at first. Some are more subtle than others.

column4: He wants to make things with his hands, not break things. He wants to give things to others — a flower to the servant girl who cleans his room, food to the mice that creep in the corners. He wants to see other people smile because of things he does. He wants to help, not to be served.
column5: [['For KabochaKitsune.', ['KabochaKitsune', '/users/KabochaKitsune/gifts']]]
column6: For KabochaKitsune, because all genders of Sanji are valid and deserve love.
column7:
So this idea has been tickling around in the back of my head for A While, and I've been struggling with writer's block for By Any Other Name, and then after I read adietxt's amazing fic bark to smoke, wood to ash, it knocked a whole bunch of words loose in my brain about my own take on the trans Sanji concept. I sat down and plonked out the first couple chapters of this fic in an afternoon.

So, have at. Obligatory disclaimer: Sanji's experience of trans masculinity is certainly not the only way someone can experience it. There are as many different ways to be trans as there are trans people in the world. Sanji's experience is also not a portrayal of my experience. It is written specifically for his character.

Also, the description of Reiju as an infant is not in any way intended to invoke the way autistic children often present at a young age. According to the Vivre Card information, Reiju's modifications at first left her as soulless as Ichiji, Niji, and Yonji, and she learned how to feel and express love from Sora. That's all I'm dealing with there.
column9: For KabochaKitsune, because all genders of Sanji are valid and deserve love.

column4:
Wei Wuxian is married off to Wen Qing for political advantages. It's all good and well for most everyone involved until the day of the marriage comes-- only for Wei Wuxian to have the most eventful wedding night in world history, learn that he shares a considerable connection to his new wife in their love of science and research, and accidentally discover an interesting new application of the spiritual lingzhi mushroom.

(Or; grandmaster-of-demonic-cultivation Wei Wuxian and let's-transfer-golden-cores Wen Qing get married politically and completely platonically, which goes about as well as could have been expected, in hindsight.)

Spanish translation on: https://w.tt/3tGIh3N
column7:
OMAKE:

LWJ: *heart burning as he dresses in his best robes only so that he may show the bride up*
WWX, a known idiot: Lan Zhan sure showed the groom up, huh!

WWX: *still thinks of LWJ while in the bridal chambers with the bride*
LWJ: All the rules I copied for my jealous actions were SO worth it.

---------------

Apologies for the period-typical sexism of Jiang Cheng asking for blood on the sheets as proof of the bride's virginity, as well as for any mistakes I might have made because of inattention or bc I'm not Chinese. Feel free to correct me any time! Thank you for reading!

I don't know if I will ever write a sequel, probably not... sorry haha. If you ask me what happens after this; I don't really know.

Does Wen Qing agree to betray the Wen Sect more officially? Does Wei Wuxian still lose his core? (actually yeah, he probably does with considerably more convincing to make Wen Qing do the surgery bc that'd be fun drama) Do they divorce eventually? Does Lan Wangji make Wen Qing take him as a concubine to live technically-married to Wei Wuxian ever after?

Who knows really. The only thing I know is that Wen Qing and Wei Wuxian being married ends up being like fire and gasoline meeting right on top of your very important furniture and documents for the powerful people of MDZS. The only cultivators that don't regret having stopped this union before it happened are all sociopaths like Xue Yang.

If anyone wants to write a sequel instead of me or to take this idea and fly with it please feel free! I'd love to read it!

Have a great day XD

My twitter

column4:
“They want humiliation,” he had explained to Nie Mingjue in that air conditioned room, speaking almost too softly to be heard over the roar of the fans. “They want your brother to make a fool of himself in the arena. But they will be satisfied with your lover making a mockery of you on every screen from here to Qishan.”

---

Meng Yao volunteers for Nie Huaisang.
column6:
A note about the tagged relationships: all of them are present in the fic to some degree, but because of POV and plot limitations, the only ones that will be getting large amounts of focus are Nieyao and Xiyao.

I have chosen not to use archive warnings to avoid the spoilers inherent to the MCD warning, but this is a Hunger Games plot: there will be death, violence, and sexual themes. There will also be fade to black underage sex.

Nie Zonghui is genderswapped in this because the lack of canon female Nie cultivators oppresses me personally.

You can find me on tumblr @ henshengs.

column4:
"When someone hits you, take the hit. Look back up at them, and grin in their face. This unsettles them. This means you are in control."

 

"When someone hits you, take the hit. Crumple to the floor. Go limp and stay there. They'll get bored and leave soon enough."

 

On the evening of a military ball none of them really want to go to, Anakin and Obi-Wan have very different advice to give Rex and Cody, respectively.

column4:
An anomaly of his cultivation sends Wen Ruohan back in time from the moment of his death, to back when the Xuanwu has only just been killed. The first thing he does, of course, is to go take that demonic cultivator from the Jiang Sect and into his own.

No matter how many times he lives, Wen Ruohan will never learn that arrogance is his greatest downfall.

(Or; a demonic cultivator, a doctor, an archer, a prisoner, and a spy team up to defeat the Wen Sect, much to the shock of the many other sects.)

Spanish translation on: https://my.w.tt/yEqx7YgCccb
column7:
BAMF Wei Wuxian is my bread and butter, I swear, I can't write enough of him. I do apologise for my second fic also being about the Wen Sect. What can I say? I love me some Wen Qing-Wen Ning-Wei Wuxian bonding.

Some explanations in case anyone was confused:
Xiao Chao means Little Chao it's like saying A-Chao, so his parent can call him that.
Wen Ruohan calls Wang Lingjiao "Jiaojiao" bc that's what Wen Chao calls her and he doesn't care to know her name.
Just the same, he calls Madam Yu "Madam Jiang" bc he can't be assed to learn what she wants to be called.

I'm going from book canon in this, so Meng Yao was behind Wen Ruohan when he used Chord Assassination to kill him-- so Wen Ruohan didn't see who it was. Chord Assassination is a Lan Sect technique that Meng Yao (I headcanon) only learned bc he read the books that Lan Xichen took with himself. Wen Ruohan thus deduced that it must have been a Lan assassin hiding amongst his servants that killed him.

I hope my characterisation of Wen Ruohan wasnt too off the mark! He's not described much, haha!

I hope you enjoyed :) Leave a comment or two! (Pls)

column4:
The resentful energy occupying Wei Wuxian's body like an enemy army is very interested in giving him Lan Wangji, tied up with a bow.

Wei Wuxian is hoping that Lan Wangji (who is far too noble and very keen to save Wei Wuxian's misguided soul) doesn't find out about any aspect of that.
column6:
Thanks to Aralias for betaing.

The title is from Tennyson's Maud. Tentacle porn with a Tennyson title is Tenntycle porn. That's the rule. Stay tuned for Idylls of Wen Qing.

I used AOYeet for the html conversion.

“Love is a sacrament that should be taken kneeling, and Domine non sum dignus should be on the lips and in the hearts of those who receive it.” is Wilde, and there's a slightly re-worked version herein (classic gays 4 classic gays).

'Singing in the dark times' is reworked Brecht. (Classic SJ Warriors 4 Classic--)

'I could take him (oh you meant in a FIGHT)' is of course adapted from the tweets of lyric poet Lil Nas X.
column7: Jedigranger did fanart for this story!

column4:
Being born as the fifth child of the once prosperous Tsunemori family has never been easy for Honōka. Throw in the fact that she was Tachibana Tomoe first, a troubled girl from Tokyo who grew up in the 90s, and you have a recipe for disaster.

Having struggled with social cues even as Tomoe, being stuck in the infant body of Tsunemori Honōka does not help her case. As the only dark-haired child born to fair-haired parents, Honōka faces hostility, uncertainty, and abuse from the members of her new family.

A child that does not resemble their parents is, as they say, the child of an oni.
column6: A couple people have asked if they need to know who Tachibana Tomoe is... Tachibana Tomoe is an original character in this setting who (unfortunately) shares a name with another character from Absolute Duo XD my bad!

column4:
The picture is of Wei Ying, that much is clear. It’s of a lot more of Wei Ying than Lan Zhan is used to seeing. He supposes that, technically, Wei Ying is dressed. It’s a bare technicality, since one of Wei Ying’s hands has rucked up his black tank top practically to his collarbone, showing a long expanse of abdomen and one nipple. Sweat beads on his sternum, catching the light like jewels. His other hand is--Lan Zhan feels his eyes widen, as though unable to look away from a train wreck--on his hip, one thumb tugging down the waistband of a pair of red briefs. Wei Ying is biting his lower lip and looking directly into the camera, sultry, his eyes dark and inviting. His erection is obvious, outlined against the red of the briefs and framed carefully with the hand on his hip. Lan Zhan’s brain goes wildly, screamingly blank.

Or: Lan Zhan accidentally finds his best friend's OnlyFans account and has an ongoing emotional crisis.
column6:
This fic has a podfic here by Rhea314!

This fic has a Spanish translation here by evirtual3!

This fic has a Russian translation here by Orange_Unicorn_of_Freedom!

There's cover art by Adrian Kres on Twitter here and by Lily Rose on Twitter here!

This took a lot of turns from where I started with it and went places I wasn't expecting it to go, so I have created a detailed list of content warnings over on my Tumblr. These contain spoilers for the fic, so be forewarned! As a blanket content warning, Lan Zhan in this is incredibly anxious and that feeds into every part of the writing. It has a happy ending, though, I promise!
column7:
Hi, here's my second modern AU for this show. I used to never like modern AUs and then The Untamed happened!

If you're kicking around the idea of setting up an OnlyFans for yourself because it seems cool and trendy, I'm here to straight-up tell you, FUCKING DON'T. Sex work is real work, and the people who rely on it to survive don't need tourists dipping their toes because they're curious about it. The world is still super shitty to sex workers, and people do get outed to their friends and family, and they do get fired from their jobs for this. Only do sex work if you're willing to accept the potential consequences, and while you're at it, help change the culture so those consequences cease to be.

If you find a friend on OnlyFans when you weren't expecting to? Well, like my fictional blogger says, “chill the fuck out and for god’s sake don’t tell anyone.”

P.S. Pay for your porn!

column4:
As an atheist, Shen Yuan has never been really sure what’s going to be waiting for him once his immune system decides to pack its bags once and for all, leaving him to perish.

When he dies and it turns out his soul has been abducted by a chirpy transmigration SYSTEM that seems pretty set on helping him “fix” the novel he apparently has been yeeted into, Shen Yuan finds himself stuck between a rock and a hard place.

Considering he’s rather fond of not dying again — once is enough, thank you very much —, Shen Yuan is going to have to bullshit his way through life as the head disciple of Qing Jing Peak, and somehow establish himself as a respectable cultivator without giving away the fact that he’s a Gen Z-kid with absolutely no survival skills and even less common sense.

He’s going to con the hell out of this.

(In one way or another).

(He just hopes he doesn’t have to sacrifice what little is left of his dignity to keep his limbs attached to his body…)

 

Or, alternatively: Shen Yuan dies in a hospital bed, and transmigrates into the dumpsterfire novel his little sister has been raging about.

column7:
the term ah-ma (阿媽) means "grandmother" and, according to Wikipedia, does not refer to a wet nurse or a servant, but rather a "friend" who helps a family to raise a child (something like a nanny in English)

da-ge, er-ge, xiao-ge, and meimei stand for 'eldest brother', 'second eldest brother', 'youngest brother', and 'younger sister', respectively

thoughts??

column4:
When a burst of toxin hits Wonder Woman, Superman, and Batman the JLA rushes them to the Watchtower medbay. As Wonder Woman and Superman wake up it becomes clear that this gas makes its victims lose their inhibitions, and the team shudders to think what the Dark Knight will do with no reservations and a missing no-kill policy. However, once the Bat does rouse, he just might give them the shock of their lives

The 'Star Trek:The Naked Time' AU no one asked for a.k.a. Bruce loses all filters and won't shut up about his kids

Part 4 of my Justice League discovers the Batfam series!
column7: Here it is! Part 4! I had a really good time writing this one you guys, I hope you love it. Tried to get nearly every Batfamily member I know anything about into this one. Thanks for reading! I do not own DC comics nor anything associated with it, and let's be real that's probably a good thing. Title taken from the song 'Unwritten' by Natasha Bedingfield. Happy reading!

column2: rather cruelly used and rather reserved
column4: In the month between Lan Wangji and Wei Wuxian leaving Yi City and their attending the cultivation conference in Lanling, Wei Wuxian discovers a locked room in the Jingshi. It is a mystery that clever and curious Wei Wuxian is doing everything in his power to avoid solving.
column6:
“Their suspense was diverted, however, by a discovery which was made in the afternoon, throwing more light on Boldwood's conduct and condition than any details which had preceded it.

That he had been from the time of Greenhill Fair until the fatal Christmas Eve in excited and unusual moods was known to those who had been intimate with him; but nobody imagined that there had shown in him unequivocal symptoms of the mental derangement which Bathsheba and Oak, alone of all others and at different times, had momentarily suspected. In a locked closet was now discovered an extraordinary collection of articles. There were several sets of ladies’ dresses in the piece, of sundry expensive materials; silks and satins, poplins and velvets, all of colours which from Bathsheba's style of dress might have been judged to be her favourites. There were two muffs, sable and ermine. Above all there was a case of jewellery, containing four heavy gold bracelets and several lockets and rings, all of fine quality and manufacture. These things had been bought in Bath and other towns from time to time, and brought home by stealth. They were all carefully packed in paper, and each package was labelled "Bathsheba Boldwood." a date being subjoined six years in advance in every instance.

These somewhat pathetic evidences of a mind crazed with care and love were the subject of discourse in Warren's malt-house when Oak entered from Casterbridge with tidings of the kiln glow shone upon it, told the tale sufficiently well. Boldwood, as every one supposed he would do, had pleaded guilty, and had been sentenced to death.

The conviction that Boldwood had not been morally responsible for his later acts now became general.”

Thomas Hardy, "Far from the Madding Crowd"
column7:
- Thanks to Elviaprose for the beta!

- It’s not the right magical tradition, but I’m thinking about this bedroom designed for King James I re: these foundation timbres, and how the carving evidently took place at the lumberyard before the beams were transported and installed: http://hypocritereader.com/88/charming-home

- This is what I think the general layout of the central Lan complex is, based off aerial shots, and what I decided for this fic the Jingshi itself is a bastardised version of: https://www.chinahighlights.com/travelguide/architecture/siheyuan.htm

- I know about Ru ware because @quigonejinn did an informative thread on the topic.

- This thread is what I'm working with for 'why no interior doors?' I initially wanted a cloister-courtyard walkway. https://twitter.com/sanlanglovemail/status/1299772748424675334

- The names of the other buildings (calm pine breeze, flowing stream, bright moon) are per the Rakuten Viki translation.

- 'Why does this place have amazing plumbing?' Well historically, given the topography of Gusu, there's a good chance it would: https://www.quora.com/Did-any-ancient-Chinese-people-have-plumbing (I find some of the language in these answers kind of casually racist, but the data is good.)

- The title is a description of Boldwood from "Far From the Madding Crowd".

- @mongrelmind: Ooh you know how easily that's made tragic though, at least in novel verse: None of the robes and clothes stuff fit resurrected Wei ying in mo xuanyu's body
Me: Lwj looks like crying and wwx is like baby baby tailoring!!
@mongrelmind: Lwj pours one out for Wei Wuxian's og body

column4:
Ed loves his little brother. Their dad isn't exactly great at the whole parenting thing, but that just means Ed has to pick up the slack. Which is fine. They have each other, and it's not as though he's going to let anything happen to Al—and Ed knows that one day, Al will be an amazing hero.

Or:

There isn't a world in which Ed doesn't sacrifice everything to save his brother.
column6:
As a warning, this work is going to be dealing with a lot of sensitive issues and heavy/dark themes. There will be graphic depictions of violence. Not every potential trigger is going to be tagged since many of them are limited to one chapter and are not relevant thematically to the story. However if a chapter contains an untagged potential trigger, I'll put a warning in the notes. If I've missed something, please let me know and I'll add a warning to the relevant chapter.

There will be times in which the perspective of the character I'm writing from does not necessarily reflect my own views on certain topics. There will also be characters whose morals heavily deviate from what is considered an acceptable moral code in our society. Whilst I don't see this becoming a major issue, I thought it would be best to clear up any doubts now rather than later on.

With that, I just want to say thank you for giving this story a go <3

column4:
“Uh…” Shen Yuan asks after a moment goes by without the blade moving away. “What are you doing?”

“Testing your naivety,” Shen Jiu says, voice as cool and sharp as the kitchen knife he’s holding to Shen Yuan’s neck. “And wondering how you didn’t get ripped to shreds when your soul occupied my body in that alternate reality you talk about.”

 

Or: Shen Jiu transmigrates from Proud Immortal Demon Way into the modern world and, somehow, Shen Yuan befriends him.

enjoy!
column7:
thank you so much for reading! i could honestly write about this AU for years, but the story had to stop at some point.
I also have so many details in mind, like the technicalities of all this travelling across universes thing, or instances where the fraternal bond 2shen created shines more, but maybe i'll write more on this or that in the future.

i would really appreciate any form of feedback!! and thank you once again for reading ♡

column4: On the war front, Mobei-Jun is allowing his generals to take the spoils of the army they just defeated, Shang Qinghua at his side. Yet, he's been acting weird lately towards him, growling at people who get two close and generally being attached to Shang Qinghua. When an general makes an untoward comment to what is Mobei-Jun's, things only seem to get worse. Well, we all know how that goes.

column4:
Ed doesn’t exactly start out intending to hide his relationship with Roy from the rest of the BAU—it just kind of happens.

The one in which Ed and Roy were dragged into the Criminal Minds world and are trying to make the best of it, but their secrets can't stay hidden forever.
column6:
Series and work title inspired by Nikita Gill's "Wreckage"
There is nothing beautiful about the wreckage of a human being...
column7: Originally posted as a series of drabbles on my Tumblr, but grew into something else. This section of the story is complete and will be posted probably every few days until it is all up. It has been edited to make a more cohesive story and smooth out some continuity issues I didn't bother cleaning up when it was more a self-indulgent exercise than an actual story. I've gone over it a lot, but if you find any inconsistencies, please let me know!

column4:
Killed at Qiongqi Pass, Jin Zixuan wakes to find himself in an old and familiar scenario; the day he and Wei Wuxian fought in Gusu Lan. The day his betrothal to Jiang Yanli came to an end.

Unsure whether or not he's dreaming, Jin Zixuan decides to seize the chance and change the future. But for that he'll need help from his bastard brother, Meng Yao.
column7:
* First segment directly taken from the drabble of the same name.
* It was obvious in the novel that neither JFM or JGS wanted that marriage.
* As JZx the Peadick continues to prove himself worthy of that title.
* JZX had a LOT of nightmares after his Re:Birth. Given how he died, he can't be blamed.
* MY does not understand his brother at all. Not even slightly.
* Slight canon difference here. MS is still alive and part of the reason MY came to Koi Tower was in hopes of getting her help.
* JZX wants to be Prince Charming from the fairy tales. Fortunately, his heart really is big and kind and it isn't all for show.
* MY's lack of understanding of cultivation is showing here. He has no idea how fast a flying cultivator can go.
* JZX is starting to feel quite big-brotherly towards MY. MY is not at all sure how to feel about it.
* Noogies will probably happen in the future, however. Because brothers.
* MY's first flight will be an edification. And, like all my versions of him, flying is Da Bomb and he wants to do it again.

column4:
Shang Qinghua slips up, revealing himself not only as a transmigrator but as the author himself. Together, Shen Qingqiu and Shang Qinghua have about a year to figure out how to manipulate the plot around the Endless Abyss without being insta-killed by the System, which is difficult and dangerous but surprisingly straightforward—all they have to do is make a deal with a demon.

…Or two. Three, tops.
column6:
The title is not from anything this time! I just went "what's something vaguely poetic-sounding that I can project onto this fic," and this is what came to mind. Also called the "Circumventing the Abyss AU" in my drafts.

Potential triggers: mild body horror, vague references to past sexual abuse (not involving the main characters), mentioned off-screen violence, implied sexual content.
column7:
Tianlang-jun: Everything in the world is about power, except power, which is about sex. Yes, he did help Binghe plan his seduction technique and almost ruined it by giving him a line from porn. Tianlang-jun also gave advice to Mobei-jun, but Mobei-jun had too much pride to use Tianlang-jun's lines (which is unfortunate, because Shang Qinghua probably would've gone for it if Mobei-jun had been able to spit them out).

Scenes/ideas that were planned but didn't fit in:
-Huan Hua Palace disciples dispersing to complete their training while they decide if they want to fold into the existing sects or try to salvage HHP & Gongyi Xiao going to Qing Jing Peak, but Shen Qingqiu not spending much time with him because it made him miss Binghe;
-Tianlang-jun asking Binghe if knowing Shen Qingqiu's underhanded involvement in the overthrow of HHP lowered Binghe's opinion of him, and Binghe saying no, because he believes that Shen Qingqiu had noble motives, Shen Qingqiu has acted in secret before on behalf of others' safety/well-being, and "there is no such thing as a dishonorable action if you are dealing with a dishonorable person";
-Tianlang-jun having reservations about Shen Qingqiu's motivations (seemingly) revolving around Luo Binghe, given the unavoidable comparison to the Old Palace Master and Su Xiyan, but Shen Qingqiu and the Old Palace Master having diametrically opposed motives and goals (with the later revelation of Shen Qingqiu's Without A Cure poisoning confirming that, despite what feelings may or may not have been at play, Shen Qingqiu and Luo Binghe had never been physically intimate);
-Shen Qingqiu leaving and reentering the meeting room and Tianlang-jun noting that you can tell who admires Shen Qingqiu (whether human or demon) because they straighten their posture/become more polite around Shen Qingqiu, with the exception of Shang Qinghua, who relaxes.

Footnotes:
[1]: To simplify, in the legend of the white snake, there is a snake that lives in a lake and can turn into a woman, and she falls in love with and eventually marries a human scholar named Xu Xuan. The other myth being referenced is the cowherd and the weaver girl, which I think will be more recognizable to MDZS fans. The weaver girl is the daughter of a goddess and falls in love with a human cowherd; her mother then separates them so they can only meet once a year. Of course, Shen Qingqiu doesn’t see himself as someone that anyone would have romantic feelings for and Tianlang-jun already has this flirtatious, teasing, even romantic disposition, so Shen Qingqiu dismisses the comparisons without considering that Tianlang-jun might be genuine (even if he is still obviously teasing).
[2]: The joke here is that the Zaolian of the title (皁莲) means "black lotus," not to be confused with Zaolian (皁恋), or "puppy love."
[3]: I debated whether to write this as "huli jing" or "fox demon," but I decided that "huli jing" carried the meaning of "seducing men to steal their power/bring them under the demon's thrall" that would be missing if I'd said "fox demon."

Side note: the Scum Villain wiki told me that demons who are also part-human can't have the "jun" title, but the wiki has been pretty sketchy for the past couple of months, so I'm ignoring that. The same day I saw that, Mobei-jun was listed as Luo Binghe's father.

Also, I've posted a lot lately?? Days apart, and it's not like I started anything from scratch (except for chapter 4 of the multi-chapter fic), but I still feel like I should take a nap. Maybe hibernate.

If you read this far, thank you and thank you again!

column4:
Shen Yuan gets to start his new life as a happy fox in what is literally Hell. He likes it here, they have so many cute creatures for him to study.

However Shen Yuan is also a millennial and he will have his creature comforts if he has to build them himself. In which the best motivation for a lazy person is to put in a lot of effort at the start so they can laze off in even more comfort later. Also known as, Shen Yuan builds a house in the Abyss.
column5: [['Inspired byLittle House in the Hellscape Prairie by TartCherryScones.', ['Little House in the Hellscape Prairie', '/works/23032177'], ['TartCherryScones', '/users/TartCherryScones/pseuds/TartCherryScones']]]
column6:
I just really like worldbuilder!Shen Yuan where he devotes his time to fleshing out the creatures and monsters in the abyss rather than deal with plot or romance. I like him as somewhere on the ace spectrum because reading porn for the plot is 100% a very Ace thing to do (or a very gay thing to do as canon goes with).

I'm not gonna lie, I did ZERO research about building houses or anything here and just used faint memories of youtube videos of people building stuff as a guideline. Feel free to roast me about unrealistic plumbing.
column7:
Who’s the body? It’s up to you! Could be Luo Bing-ge as per PIDW. Could be Liu Qingge accidentally following a beast into the rift. Could be Original!Shen Qingqiu getting thrown into the Abyss instead of Luo Bing-ge. It’s up to you.

Also lol that arm was one of Tianlang-Jun's that he lost when he was dicking about in the Abyss at some point.

Edit: The response has been so nice I'm really looking into a continuation of this. Don't expect it anytime soon though, because I'm currently paralyzed by indecision as to who the body actually is. This is why I left it open! Because I couldn't decide when I was writing this. If I get too frustrated I might go for saying all of them fell down.

column4:
Over the course of one week, Midoriya Izuku sees his childhood friend turned bully face consequences for his actions, gets appreciated for his skills, acquires a boyfriend that sits right in front of him, realizes that his grumpy homeroom teacher is actually on his side, and tells Aizawa Shouta the truth about One for All.

All of that information, however? It's happening in the background. Follow our hero: Aizawa Shouta aka Eraserhead. Over the course of the same week, Aizawa looks into his Problem Child and his many contradictions in order to not see Midoriya Izuku and Bakugou Katsuki paired together for their upcoming final exam.

During this time, Aizawa learns things he should have known from the start, talks to a lot of people, drinks so much hot chocolate, loves his husband, feeds his cat, gets a shocking six hours of sleep, reflects on his past, and learns the truth about a legend passed through underground heroics for decades.
column6:
Welcome everyone! It's my first completed chapter fic that wasn't part of a Big Bang! Well almost completed. I have like another 1500 words of the last chapter to go, but it's basically done.

This is a fic that I've been working on alongside Future AU fic series called In the After. It's not part of the verse. I just wrote this because I'm such a hoe for "Aizawa finds out about Izuku's past", "Aizawa finds out about OFA", and "Bakugou faces consequences for his action".

Thirteen chapters later, here we are! So I hope that you enjoy it. I'll be posting a new chapter every Wednesday at some point in the day. And I hope you enjoy it.

column6: Look I wrote like 75% of this back when I was actually writing Armed and Dangerous. And then like a month ago I was going through all of my WIPs in googledocs, and there it was. The final bit of A&D that will make the series officially complete (insofar as there are no fragments left to add on). A thing that no one will care about because nearly a DECADE has passed since I created this silly background character. And I thought, yes. Yes, this trifle must be finished, even if "finished" is very much a relative, slapdash term in this context. Tah. Dah.

column4:
Dumbass crew newbie hides in the vents and makes a friend. In unrelated news, local impostor is having a really weird day.

"You've got something there," Green motions to Black's chest, which has a splat of dark liquid across it. 

"It's… oil. From the, you know. The rear axial. Distributor." He waves at a panel on the wall, a panel which Green thought was an extra trash chute, but evidently not.

"Thanks," Green says, and means it. "Sometimes it feels like I'm the only one who actually cares about getting us all out of here alive, you know?"

column2: children, hypocrisy, (that's what I give, you can take it from me)
column4:
Haruno Sakura grew up in a world which shunned her very existence, a place she could never quite bring herself to call home, somewhere where she never quite managed to fit in.

She knows the reason for this, though – that being her father does not belong to that world, or so her mother eventually told her – and with the war finally behind her, she sets off to find him. With hope in her heart, she travels to her father’s homeland, eager to find her place there. But family relationships are tricky, and Sakura finds herself stumped by the task set before her, because her father believes her and her mother dead.

It’s one thing to introduce herself to her estranged father, but another thing entirely for her to shatter the world he’s built in the wake of the assumed loss of his family.
column6:
My mind is drowning in plot bunnies and I can't concentrate until I've written more out, so... here's another crossover of my usual sort, but as you can see from the tags, the Glorfindel-Sakura relationship is rather different this time.

This work is mainly about the whole finding family and subsequently trying to build a relationship with said estranged members. Random alternate titles for this fic spawned in my head which should explain the gist of things, such as: 'What to do when you find out your elf child has been a mercenary since the tender age of twelve', '"I'm not a child." "Sakura, you do realise elves are considered fully grown when they turn fifty?"', and also 'How to break the news to your father about the fact that not only did his wife not die, but she also gave birth to a healthy girl whose been raised in a world with vastly different views on what constitutes a good childhood.'

Yeah, so this is going to be fun, and also different from my more plotty works - since the plot of this one is less... action intense.

The title of this work comes from the song 'Glory' by Hollywood Undead (I've been listening to it far too much, which is why there are a few works with a line or two as a title). Here's to hoping there won't be any comments telling me this title is inappropriate for such a work.

column2: when it comes time to rest my head
column4:
When Nie Mingjue spots the freshly bloodied handkerchief Jin Guangyao accidentally drops, his first sickening conclusion is that he's just caught him in the middle of some nefarious deed--but Nie Mingjue investigates further, and instead uncovers a series of injuries across Jin Guangyao's body that tell a much more heart-wrenching tale than the one Nie Mingjue first suspected.

Can Nie Mingjue earn back enough of Jin Guangyao's trust to get him to accept the help he so clearly needs? Can he convince Jin Guangyao... to come back to Qinghe with him?
column6:
I did tag this in all the fandom categories because there are CQL-specific elements in this, but I want to specify that this is based on the novel timeline/sequences of events with Meng Yao's departure from Qinghe, and not the CQL version where he gets sent away because he murders a dude. In the novel, my was thriving in Qinghe until nmj unfortunately overheard a conversation between lxc and my and thought being sent to Lanling was what my wanted :(

The explicit rating hits in chapter 3 and is marked off and skippable. The rating for the rest of the story probably hovers around T for discussions of abuse and language.

Also, KeeperofSeeds has recorded a lovely podfic (linked at the bottom) for anyone who wants to go check that out! :D

column4:
There was another boy there at the base of the balcony outside of Meng Shi's window, where Meng Yao liked to sit: a boy few years older than him, taller, in finely made clothing that would normally make Meng Yao itch all over in futile envy, but the other boy’s eyes were white around the edges in a way that was immediately, painfully familiar.

“Someone’s chasing you?” Meng Yao asked, and the boy’s eyes widened even further, surprised, but he nodded in confirmation. “There’s a trellis around the left side – can you climb up? I'll hide you.”

"Thanks," the boy said, later, once the man he called Wen Ruohan had left. "My name is Nie Mingjue. What's yours?"

column2: A Queen's Trials (And How To Speedrun Them)
column4:
Shang Qinghua is now well on his way to the same happily-ever-after that every protagonist gets, but two things stand in his way.

The Queen's Trials, and a council that just won't give up.

Too bad for them, they really don't know who they're dealing with.

column4:
All things considered, it really was sort of obvious.

Hey! Anyone can be a genius in retrospect. Hindsight is 20/20! Besides, who can blame him! He'd never written about this facet of Mobei Jun's life before!

Still...considering all the times he'd gotten his hands on Mobei Jun's sealskin, he's sort of shocked that it took him so long to figure it out.

column4:
Catwoman's apprentice and adopted son, Jason Todd, finds Robin, Tim Drake, being chased through Crime Alley, covered in sex pollen. And he can't just leave his adoptive mom's sort of boyfriend's kind of son to die, can he? They're practically stepbrothers.
Jason gets more than he signed up for, though, when a heat-stricken Tim lets slip some worrying details.
Au where Selina adopted Jason, but Tim still became Robin on schedule.
column6:
Am I late? *glances at calendar and cringe* Yes, sorry. I was about fifteen hundred words into the story I'd originally intended to do for this prompt, but then I finally admitted that I hated it and decided to do this thing instead. Then, of course, this fic got four times longer than I intended it to be, but I'm still way happier with it than I was with the original one.
Let me know what you think!
Jason: 17
Tim: 14

column2: never knew how hard it'd be to quit you
column4:
There's a moment of absolute silence as Fives and Echo trade startled glances, Rex gapes at Obi-Wan, and Kix and Jesse freeze, eyes widening. Then, deliberately, awkwardly, Rex clears his throat, face about four shades redder than it was a moment ago. “General, you—you know Quinlan?”

No wonder they made it out of the smuggler’s mansion in one piece. Obi-Wan breathes in through his nose, lets it out, and then says, “Very well, yes. Quinlan Vos, I thought you were dead, and instead you were—were—playing hooker to a crime lord!”

column4:
Jiang Yanli lifted her eyes up to Madam Jin and said, calmly, as if from a hundred miles away, “I am a daughter of the Yu sect. Did he think my mother only taught me how to pour tea?”

Or: the AU in which Jin Guangshan targets Jiang Yanli and she kills him before he can ruin everything.
column6:
Yooooooo~

One day my wife texted me and said ‘you know what I want? I want a fic where JGS tries to have his way with JYL and she just fucking knifes him’, so I wrote it because my wife has the best ideas.

So, yes, definite trigger warning for sexual assault, but it is brief, nongraphic, and ends with a dead man.

Despite that, this fic is actually pretty warm and fluffy most of the time because hey, once Jin Guangshan is out of the way, everything goes much better! So there’s room for romance and sibling bonding and actual processing of trauma, which is what we’re all here in fandom for.

White girl note: my understanding of the Chinese naming conventions is that married women don’t change their last names, so even though Jin Guangshan’s wife’s title would be Jin-furen, her family name would still be Yu (since she is from the Yu sect). So I have named her Yu Huanfa in this AU. If I’m wrong about that and it should be Jin Huanfa, please let me know!

column2: But Among Our Own Selves We'll Be Free, or, Thomas and the Island of the Gays
column4:
After the Jimmy incident, and a harrowing attempt at conversion therapy, Thomas finds himself in a most unusual community. In which Thomas:
• Participates in an Edwardian Queer Studies seminar
• Goes camping
• Takes up journalism
• And most importantly, makes friends.

Thanks as always to Beboots for beta, cheerleading, and general awesomeness!
column6:
Continuity Note: This story follows film canon in assuming that Thomas had little-to-no contact with the gay community prior to the beginning of the story. Characters from Halo Effect/Soldier’s Heart (and some of my other stories) appear, but this is an AU where Thomas is meeting them for the first time.
Also, apologies to my Jimmy-fan friends, but this is another story where The Incident is used as a plot device to get Thomas out of Downton and heading off in an improbable direction.

Title Note: “But among our own selves we’ll be free”—refrain of a bawdy song reportedly sung in the Molly Houses of the 18th century. (Most of the other lyrics are quite indecent!). http://rictornorton.co.uk/eighteen/lechery.htm

Content Notes (General): One of the major themes of this story is the Island community attempting to assemble and articulate a positive view of homosexuality—which would have been a very uphill struggle at the time. At various points, characters express attitudes, ideas, and language choices that would have been progressive at the time, but have become part of homophobic discourse today. Some readers may find it jarring to see these views expressed by “good guys” in the story. I’ll be providing context for these views in the author’s notes, and will include chapter-by-chapter warnings. If you notice something that I’ve missed warning for, please let me know.

Content Notes (Chapter 1): Discussion of conversion therapy/psychiatric abuse, period-typical homophobia, mention to suicide, and brief period-typical racial language and attitudes. Details in endnotes.

Historical note: Given that Soldier’s Heart is known for its well-researched historical setting, I cannot overemphasize that this story’s central premise—the Island of the Gays—is utter, self-indulgent fantasy. There was no such experimental community for gay men in the British Isles at this time, and it’s virtually impossible that, had some wealthy eccentric chosen to create one, it would have been tolerated, much less given semi-official sanction as a destination for men who had been in contact with the justice system as a result of their orientation. (More in end notes.)
column7:
Content Notes (detailed):

Conversion therapy: When the story begins, Thomas has just ended a course of conversion “therapy” for his homosexuality. The details of this treatment are alluded to, rather than discussed in depth, but it’s evident that it was very unpleasant. The current environment is safe, but for most of the chapter, Thomas doesn’t know that.

Period-typical homophobia: In this chapter, the psychiatrist in charge of the island attempts to explain Thomas’s “condition” to him. In doing so, he engages with the culturally-available views of homosexuality as a crime, a moral failing, or a sickness—sometimes pushing back against these frameworks, other times accepting them. Probably most upsetting to modern eyes is the discussion of innate versus acquired homosexuality—basically, the old canard about homosexuals “converting” others to these wicked ways. This now-discredited idea was taken absolutely seriously by the legal system and public health officials at the time, and so, anyone arguing for compassionate treatment of homosexuals would have had to grapple with it.
There’s a lot more about this in the extended historical note—the doctor’s views are based on those of a real turn-of-the-20th-century sexologist.

Period-typical racial language: At one point, the doctor in charge of the Island compares Thomas’s homosexuality to the skin color of “a Negro.” In the narration, Thomas briefly wonders to whom this comparison is more insulting. That line was a bit uncomfortable to write, but the implicit racism is integral to the point the doctor is making—that both of these are natural variations that have been assigned a negative meaning by the culture in that place and time.

Historical note, continued:

Additionally, while various cures—of varying degrees of medical respectability—were offered, I am aware of no specific instance of “taking the cure” being offered as an alternative to imprisonment until the middle of the century (see: Alan Turing). If I had to bet, I’d say it probably happened from time to time, but would have been an under-the-table arrangement involving wealthy or otherwise influential individuals. The Clinic, as a medico-legal institution dedicated to the purpose, is pure invention.

“Treatments” for homosexuality ranged from Freudian psychoanalysis at one end of the spectrum, to ghastly surgical experiments involving the transplanting of testicles and other glands from heterosexual cadavers or male animals. Aversion “therapy” for homosexuality, usually involving emetics or electric shocks, is well-documented as having been used in the mid-20th century, but I’m not sure it actually existed this early. I used it because the idea of The Clinic even existing seemed more plausible if the approach was overtly punitive.

That said, there is an actual, in-period basis for Dr. L.’s approach, which are inspired by ideas expressed in Havelock Ellis’s Sexual Inversion, which went through various editions from 1897 to 1915, and can be read here: https://catalog.hathitrust.org/Record/000429575 The book includes a review of the (scant) medical and psychiatric literature on homosexuality, and extensive case histories of both male and female “inverts” (Ellis’s preferred term).

Here, I ran up against A03's length limit for endnotes, so for more about Dr. Ellis, see this post on my Tumblr: https://alex51324.tumblr.com/post/632267456679952384/extended-historical-endnote-for-chapter-one-of

TL;DR, Dr. L.’s theories about homosexuality would not strike his real-life counterparts as particularly wacky (but his putting them into practice is a different story).

column4:
“Have you heard? The Qing Jing Peak guest disciple has proposed marriage to his shizun!”

Shen Qingqiu accepts a demonic disciple into his fold, and comes to regret it years down the road.
column6:
so this fic was inspired by the five million moshang fics of sqh completely misunderstanding mbj proposing to marry him + demon courtship, except i wanted it for bingjiu, but then before i could make a proper romcom i’d have to literally retcon their whole relationship. (why do i DO this to myself, really, i could have just popped the backstory in like, three paragraphs but nooo). So here we are! SJ somehow making LBH fall in love with him without knowing it, because it turns out demons express affection in a completely different manner. (Beat him up three times a day, SQQ~!)

written for #BingJiuWeek2020. bingjiu is actually my favorite sv ship and yet somehow this is the first fic i'm posting for them hihi.

title is from Taylor Swift's Blank Space.
column7:
part 1 done!! i rushed this for #bingjiuweek2020, it's super ironic because i finished part 2 first...that should be up in a week or so :)

column9:
so this fic was inspired by the five million moshang fics of sqh completely misunderstanding mbj proposing to marry him + demon courtship, except i wanted it for bingjiu, but then before i could make a proper romcom i’d have to literally retcon their whole relationship. (why do i DO this to myself, really, i could have just popped the backstory in like, three paragraphs but nooo). So here we are! SJ somehow making LBH fall in love with him without knowing it, because it turns out demons express affection in a completely different manner. (Beat him up three times a day, SQQ~!)

written for #BingJiuWeek2020. bingjiu is actually my favorite sv ship and yet somehow this is the first fic i'm posting for them hihi.

title is from Taylor Swift's Blank Space.

column4:
Mobei Jun doesn’t sound like he’s here to settle a longtime feud with a Peak Lord, he sounds like…

Like a man whose wife ran away from home, and he’s here to set things right so that she will go home with him!

Only there is no wife in this scenario! There’s only Shang Qinghua here! And Shang Qinghua cannot possibly be Mobei Jun’s-

“Husband,” Mobei Jun whispers.

(Or, in which a system reboot causes some temporary amnesia.)
column7:
Me, posting three (3) amnesia fics in three (3) days: This is not a phase, ma!!! This is my passion!!!!!

I don't even have any excuses. I just wanted to ride the amnesia trope inspiration until it runs dry, so BEAR WITH ME BUDDIES.

Anyway hi, nobody who follows me here on Tumblr is surprised that I've started writing moshang considering how it's all I've been yelling about for the last week or so. Come and yell about moshang with me, I am BEGGING.

column2: When They Pick Through the Wreckage
column4:
The BAU have learned about Roy and Ed's automail, but Ed is hiding other secrets, and his world is about to crash into theirs.

“C’mon, pick the fuck up. I know you’re in class, but I wouldn’t fucking bother you if it wasn’t important. I know you’re mad, but fucking call me, okay? This is… It’s our stuff. We might have a way home. Even if you’re still pissed off at me or you don’t…” He stops and takes a deep breath. “Even if you don’t want there to be an us anymore… I think you’d still want to go home, if you can. I’ll text you the address. Just… call. Please?”

Immediate sequel to Nothing Beautiful About the Wreckage. Updates on Tuesdays.
column6: This is an immediate sequel to Nothing Beautiful About the Wreckage. It can probably be read without it, but would certainly make more sense if you read Nothing Beautiful first.
column7: I know I said "Thursday" but today was *really* long and I legit just lost track of the fact it's only Wednesday. So... you get chapter 1 a day early. Enjoy!

column2: The Rouge King | 红粉大王
column4:
Nie Huaisang's love of makeup turns into a business empire that has some interesting consequences.

AKA Nie Huaisang invents Sephora, saves the jiāng hú, and looks damn good doing it. With the help of his best friend and business partner Meng Yao, of course. Business twinks: they've got shit to do, people to kiss, and sect leaders to kill.

Who run the world? Twinks!

[Smut in Chapters 10 & 11]
column6:
红粉 hóng fěn: lit. rouge and powder (cosmetics), figuratively refers to feminine beauty, the fairer sex.

大王 dà wáng: lit. king, but also magnate or expert in a field.

 

[tweet]

 

---

Follows CQL canon by and large.

This entire fic was inspired by this video of Ji Li putting lipstick on. He gets compared to Li Jiaqi, who is a famous lipstick beauty guru on Douyin, and that is how this AU was born.

I'm on twitter @vivisextion.
column7:
阿姨 ā yí: auntie
公子 gōng zǐ: young master
姑娘 gū niáng: young lady

The Chinese opera play Huaisang and Meng Yao go to see is called 踏谣娘 tā yáo niáng, the Stepping and Singing Lady (alt. The Dancing and Singing Wife), a story about a woman who is abused by her drunkard husband, who later receives retribution for his actions. Traditionally, the role of the wife was played by a man, which here leads to Huaisang's first experience with gender-bending.

The theatre actor looks like Luo Yunxi (Ashes of Love) in my head.

column4:
Or the one where Jin Zixuan, Lan Wangji, and Nie Huaisang find out about 3zun in various ways with wildly different reactions.

Featuring: awkward and unwanted sex talks, gifts in the form of rabbits and turnips, and schemes and plots that never come to fruition
column6:
So, yes, this series is still alive. This fic is just a short, cincredibly silly, self-indulgent thing filled with all of my bad jokes. You don't have to read the rest of the series to understand this one, all you need to know is that wangxian is out in the burial mounds living their best lives, raising rabbits and being farmers, and nie huaisang told jgy at some point that he should really get kill his father already

And yes, I do find it incredibly ironic that this is the mdzs fic i'm post after the angst fest that was to hoard promises. 3zun is a very versatile ship, alright?

Anyway, onwards!
column7:

- So, the awkward family dinners fic morphed into a monster of a wedding negotiations fic, so that one's probably gonna take a while longer for me to figure out. Sorry about that.
-I'm acediscowlng on tumblr, if you guys want to have a chat :D

As always, your comments give me life <3

column4:
Todoroki Shouto has memories that he didn't make on his own, motor skills that his brain doesn't know how to parse, and a love of science and mathematics and physics that means he broke down his Quirk into its most intricate, universe-bending components at the age of seven.

In one universe, he wants to become a hero. In this one, even though he doesn't want to, he might have to.

 

(Featuring: a rapidly developing Shoutosquad, Quirk science, headcanons of all flavors, healthy and supportive sibling and sibling-like relationships, and Dadzawa.)
column6:
parallax: (n.) The apparent offset of a foreground object against the background when your perspective changes.

(we will not turn our faces away — when you’re ready, come outside.)
 
 

Kind of experimental, kind of a challenge to myself. Let me know if y'all enjoyed it.

Tags will be updated as we go. Rating will not go above Teen, if we ever get there. This is a story about friendship, growing up, unlearning bad habits, the terrifying ordeal of being known, having hope, a fascination with the intricacies of the universe, and the quest of stuffing shirts full of kittens, among other things.

People have made me such lovely art for this fic - they're all embedded & linked in the relevant chapters (if they're depicting scenes), as well as linked & credited in the end notes!! Please go give them some love!! <3
column7:
Listen. Listen. You can't just say that somebody creates fire from nothing but also can create ice from nothing, that's not how the universe works

(So, TL;DR: Shouto can still create fire/ice like he does in canon, and does so during spars and fights. However, he has an intimate, molecule-level physics-based understanding of what he's doing, which is that his body has endothermic (ice) and exothermic (fire) properties. As such, he can also do things like generate wind via rapidly fluctuating temperatures of air, among other things made possible by thermodynamics.)

column4:
Shang Qinghua’s face falls. “I could tell you now, my king, but you would not be predisposed to believing me, like you usually are.”

“Then why would I listen to you?”

Shang Qinghua lets out a shaky breath. “Because my husband always listens to me,” he says quietly.

(Or, the one where Mobei Jun is poisoned, and cannot remember Shang Qinghua.)

column4:
Tim Drake discovers that sometimes family is the hodgepodge gang of vigilantes and teenage superheroes from another universe that collectively decides to adopt you.

Or, with the power of hand wavy multiverse travel, a tired and beaten down comics!Tim winds up in the Young Justice cartoon universe.

Or, I have an incredibly niche obsession with this trope and will populate it myself if need be.

column7:
Thanks for reading! If you enjoyed please leave a kudos (or, better yet, a comment ;D). I will hoard any comments or criticism like the goblin I am, so don't be afraid to tell me what you think.

The Lady Shiva line is a reference back to one of Tim's first Robin comics where he trained under her. The quote is "You are nothing. You are less than nothing. You are a child. That is how your opponents must see you. They will underestimate your skills because of your age and size. That is your advantage. But you must never see yourself that way."

column4:
Lan Zhan is convinced to bring his boyfriend home to meet his family.

What he doesn't know is that Wei Ying is a former disciple of the Jiang who was kicked out in disgrace.

None of this would have happened if he and his brother hadn't been sent to boarding school after their mother's death.

column4:
"Is there a reason you're calling this late at night?" Tony asks, worried in spite of himself. "Tell me what's going on, kid."

“Everything is one-hundred-percent fine,” Peter says. “Seriously, I've never been better. But I should let you know I have about thirty bricks of cocaine in my bedroom. Also, Karen won't let me turn off Instant Kill Mode. Also, Walmart discontinued my special razzleberry pink squeezy lemonade. Which isn't related to tonight's patrol, I'm just bummed about it.”
 
Or: The five times Instant Kill Mode is activated +1

 

*Runner-up for the Soothes the Pain Award in the Iron Dad 2021 Creators Awards.*

column4:
Direct continuation from part 1:
With Sunshot Campaign ended, secret lovers Lan Xichen and Meng Yao can finally reunite. Yet, both of them are entangled in politics, post-war tidying, and trying to keep their sweeping romance under the rug. Will their scandalous relationship be uncovered? Will Meng Yao boldly go exactly where he went in canon? Is that Lan Xichen reaching for the discipline whip?? And what’s going on with little brother and his dubious necromancer in the background? Join in, and have fun finding out! :D

Comments are very much appreciated!! ᐠ( ᐛ )ᐟ

column6:
De-anon this, please!

 

Prompt:

 

Prompt:

During the Yiling era, LWJ comes to visit WWX again and they hook up, and the next time he visits he brings some supplies (food, medicine, etc.) for the Wens. (Alternatively, LWJ visits and brings supplies, and WWX has sex with him). This leads WWX to think that in order to keep getting supplies, he needs to keep having sex with LWJ as payment. He's torn because he has feelings for LWJ and likes having sex with him but he also wishes it was real (it is real for LWJ, of course, but he doesn't realize it). But ultimately they need supplies too much for WWX to put a stop to it.

Bonus if WWX is sort of self-deprecatingly kinking on the idea of being LWJ's prostitute, maybe he asks for degradation/name-calling in bed, etc.

Maybe they tend to go to the inn in Yiling to hook up, which really reinforces the whole pseudo-sex work thing.

If you want to write from LWJ's point of view, he's worried about WWX and wants to help (and has the same dilemma about liking sex with WWX but wishing it was real). He doesn't realize how WWX sees it and probably thinks it's just stress relief for WWX.

Bottom WWX only, please!

For the ending, you can either take it in a new direction or end in a canon-compliant place (with them parting ways, etc).

Canon version: Any, but this would probably make the most sense with CQL

DNW: Hard kinks, noncon between wangxian

column2: the little children raise their open filthy palms
column4:
Phil doesn’t go into the cities anymore. Once had been enough, and he doesn’t have a death wish.

He chooses only to watch them in the distance, or pass by them from time to time as he walks. The buildings loom in the distance, their once-shining rooftops now overgrown and dull with no one to take care of them. If you get close enough, you smell the stench of rot and death. It’s a smell you can never get out of your nose, discovered one night after the initial wave where Phil tried desperately to scrub out his nose, sticking cloth and then even fingers as far up as he could to try and wash the smell out of his sinuses. It didn’t work, and the smell has stayed with him since. He tries to look past it, look past the cities, and continue walking forward. That’s what he attributes his survival to, really. The ability to look past everything, stare the dead in the eyes, and still walk on after he’s shot them in the head. They were people once, but thinking about it too much makes his hands start to shake so Phil looks past it and walks on.

(SBI zombie apocalypse AU. sort of phil-centric, but not entirely!)

column2: a rose by any other name
column4:
In the best of circumstances, Shang Qinghua wouldn’t have to be cursing all the choices that Luo Binghe makes, except Luo Binghe’s every move as the venerated ruler of the realm is so carefully observed and emulated by all the other demons.

Luo Binghe takes a male consort? The demons watch and learn.

Luo Binghe’s consort is a human cultivator? The demons are taking notes.

Luo Binghe’s human consort is a Cang Qiong Peak Lord? The demons are frantically making checklists that would determine one’s suitability to be a consort, and guess who ticks all the boxes.

(Or, the one where Shang Qinghua suddenly becomes Prime Demon Marriage Material™.)
